alert.note: Alert for Monona (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 9:42PM CDT until March 17 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 1 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of west central Iowa and east central and northeast Nebraska. * WHEN...From 4 AM Thursday to 1 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
